The files currently use camel case naming (like "Nunito-Bold.ttf") rather than hyphens, but I'll rename them to use underscores between the words:"}],"tool_calls":[{"id":"toolu_bdrk_0178mtp6yLhhg8rVsaQ1Z9Qd","type":"function","function":{"name":"run_terminal_cmd","arguments":"{"command": "cd app/src/main/res/font && ren \"Nunito-Black.ttf\" \"Nunito_Black.ttf\"", "is_background": false, "explanation": "Renaming Nunito-Black.ttf to Nunito_Black.ttf"}"}}]},{"role":"tool","name":"run_terminal_cmd","tool_call_id":"toolu_bdrk_0178mtp6yLhhg8rVsaQ1Z9Qd","content":"Command output:

```
tf" "Nunito_Black.ttf"

+ cd app/src/main/res/font && ren "Nunito-Black.ttf"
"Nunito_Black.ttf"
+ ~~
The token '&&' is not a valid statement separator in this 
version.

 nsErrorRecordException
 + FullyQualifiedErrorId : InvalidEndOfLine

PS D:\MyProjects>
```

On the next terminal tool call, the directory of the shell will already be D:\MyProjects\."},{"role":"assistant","content":[{"type":"text","text":"

Let me correct the approach for Windows PowerShell:"}],"tool_calls":[{"id":"toolu_bdrk_019VzfQ78McxcVuaYtKupMfm","type":"function","function":{"name":"run_terminal_cmd","arguments":"{"command": "cd .\\app\\src\\main\\res\\font\\; Get-ChildItem -Filter \"*.ttf\" | ForEach-Object { $newName = $_.Name -replace '-', '_'; Rename-Item -Path $_.FullName -NewName $newName }", "is_background": false, "explanation": "Using PowerShell to rename all font files replacing hyphens with underscores"}"}}]},{"role":"tool","name":"run_terminal_cmd","tool_call_id":"toolu_bdrk_019VzfQ78McxcVuaYtKupMfm","content":"Command output:

```
lter "*.ttf" | ForEach-Object { $newName = $_.Name -replace '-',
 '_'; Rename-Item -Path $_.FullName -NewName $newName }
PS D:\MyProjects\app\src\main\res\font>
```

Good news! Your files are still there in the app/src/main/res/font directory. They've just been renamed from using hyphens (-) to using underscores (_) as you requested. 

For example:
- Nunito-Bold.ttf is now Nunito_Bold.ttf
- Nunito-Regular.ttf is now Nunito_Regular.ttf

If your Android project can't find these files, you might need to update any references to these fonts in your XML files or Java/Kotlin code to use the new names with underscores instead of hyphens."}]},{"role":"user","content":[{"type":"text","text":"<user_query>
